metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22757 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
Remote Agent, used in WebDriver, did not validate the Host or Origin headers. This could have allowed websites to connect back locally to the user's browser to control it.
*This bug only affected Firefox when WebDriver was enabled, which is not the default configuration.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 97. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22757` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu1 firefox-geckodriver - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu1 firefox-mozsymbols - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
